definition: to pester/to bother sb incessantly/to delay/to prevaricate
grindstone/to grind/to turn round
to rub/to grind/to polish/to sharpen/to wear down/to die out/to waste time/to pester/to insist
to feel vexed/to bother/to trouble/superfluous and confusing/edgy

sentences.english: He is not enough skilled in driving. Vehicles behind him all complain that he is delaying them.
sentences.chinese: 开车的技术还不熟练，他后边的车都嫌他磨烦。

definition: to wear out the skin of one's teeth (idiom); pointlessly blather/to talk incessant nonsense/blah blah
thus/in this way/like this
to be very slow/to dawdle
indignant
bullet-headed/stubborn
to try by all available methods
to vent anger
to grumble/to chatter
child bride/girl adopted into a family as future daughter-in-law
to look for blemishes/to find fault/nitpicking
to sound out opinions/to get sb's views by polite or indirect questioning/also written 探口風|探口风[tan4 kou3 feng1]
to persuade using all possible arguments (idiom); to act good cop and bad cop in turn
to flatter/to butter sb up
(dialect) to dawdle/to waste time/also written 墨跡|墨迹[mo4 ji5]
verbose or unclear in speech/rambling and indistinct
to suffer a rebuke/criticized
